required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Performance of Antenatal Ultrasound in the Localization of Intestinal Structures Involved in Malrotation With a Higher-risk of Volvulus
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Performance of Antenatal Ultrasound in the Localization of Intestinal Structures Involved in Malrotation With a Higher-risk of Volvulus

brief_summary.textblock:
The aims of this study are:
- To assess the performance of third-trimester ultrasound scan in the localization of intestinal structures (small bowel, gut, mesenteric vessels..) involved in malrotations with a higher-risk of volvulus compared to a gold standard based on fetal MRI.
- To describe normal meconium progression (ultrasound and MRI), prenatal anatomical variants of the fetal digestive tract, and interobserver agreement on prenatal ultrasound.

primary_outcome.measure: Ultrasound localization of intestinal structure (mesenteric vessels, small bowel, gut)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the visit 1 of the subjects
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be ultrasound localization of intestinal structure (mesenteric vessels, small bowel, gut)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the visit 1 of the subjects
secondary_outcome.description: Normal meconium progression will be described by the results of ultrasound examination and MRI

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women with a singleton pregnancy over 28 weeks
arm_group.description: All pregnant women with a singleton pregnancy over 28 weeks and having to perform a fetal MRI to identify a cerebral, pulmonary or renal fetal malformation, or due to a diagnostic doubt on ultrasound on an abnormality of these structures , will be proposed inclusion in the study.

intervention.description: Use of antenatal ultrasound examination to visualize and position the intestinal structures involved in digestive malrotation at high risk of volvulus and comparison to fetal MRI results.
intervention.arm_group_label: Women with a singleton pregnancy over 28 weeks

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women with normal intestinal structure and requiring a fetal MRI for other reason

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women over the age of 18
- Good understanding of French
- Single pregnancy
- Gestational age greater than 28 weeks
- Fetal MRI indication validated in multidisciplinary staff at weekly meetings of the Multidisciplinary Prenatal Diagnosis Center in Montpellier or Nimes
- Affiliation or beneficiary of a social security scheme
- Declaration of free and enlightened opposition
Exclusion Criteria:
- Complex fetal abdominal malformations responsible for difficult interpretation of imaging: heterotaxis with asplenia or polysplenium, diaphragmatic hernia, omphalocele, gastroschisis, digestive pathology, abdominal tumor, bladder exstrophy or megavessia.
- Fetal chromosomal abnormality
- Body mass index of mother> 40kg / m2 in early pregnancy
- Request for termination of pregnancy validated by a Multidisciplinary Pre-natal Diagnosis Center
